summary: Dr. John S. Dalton, II, M.D. was found guilty of unprofessional conduct in the practice of medicine for two separate incidents involving aggressive, verbally abusive, and physically intimidating behavior towards patient care assistants, including religiously charged remarks towards one and physical assault towards another. His medical license was suspended for a minimum of six months, and he was ordered to enroll in the Maryland Professional Rehabilitation Program and undergo an evaluation.
